rules: Rule1: Provided that a security officer is on senior officer duty, then if it is not the case that whenever a security officer is present, a passenger at the checkpoint shows identification, the security officer requests authorization from a supervisor.

Rule2: Whenever a security officer is on junior officer duty, then if it is not the case that under the condition that a security officer is present, a passenger at the checkpoint shows identification, the security officer requests authorization from a supervisor.
Rule3: Provided that a security officer is on day shift, then the security officer is on senior officer duty.
Rule4: Either a security officer is on day shift or a security officer is on night shift.
Rule5: If a security officer is on night shift, then the security officer is on junior officer duty.
Rule6: Provided that a vehicle inspection is required, then security clearance is granted to a passenger.
Rule7: If alcohol is detected in a vehicle, then it is not the case that the vehicle is cleared.
Rule8: Under the condition that a suspicious package is in a vehicle, the vehicle is not cleared.
Rule9: Either a passenger has valid identification or the passenger is not allowed to board the flight.
Rule10: Either boarding is announced for a flight or the gate is opened for a flight.
Rule11: Whenever the gate is opened for a flight, then passenger boarding is occurring for the flight or security clearance is granted to a passenger.
Rule12: Provided that boarding has started for a flight, then either passenger boarding is occurring for the flight or security clearance is granted to a passenger.

Rule13: If a security breach is detected by the security system, then whenever it is not the case that provided boarding is announced for a flight, boarding has started for the flight, boarding is not delayed for the flight.
Rule14: Under the condition that a passenger passed the security check, the passenger has no restricted items.
Rule15: Either a passenger passed the security check or the passenger does not have valid identification.
Rule16: If an alert is triggered by the security system, then a security breach is detected by the security system.
Rule17: Provided that the security system is activated, an alert is triggered by the security system.
Rule18: Whenever there is unauthorized access to an area, then if security clearance is not granted to a passenger, the terminal is not under emergency lockdown.
Rule19: Either there is unauthorized access to an area or suspicious activity is detected in an area.

Rule20: If security protocol is activated by the security system, then whenever suspicious activity is detected in an area, provided security clearance is not granted to a passenger, the terminal is not under emergency lockdown.
Rule21: Provided that a false alarm is triggered by the security system, the warning light is on for the security system.
Rule22: If a false alarm is triggered by the security system, then it is not the case that the alarm is sounding on the security system.
Rule23: Either a false alarm is triggered by the security system or the terminal is not under normal operations.
Rule24: Whenever the warning light is on for the security system, the alarm is sounding on the security system.
Rule25: Provided that a passenger has no restricted items, the passenger is cleared for boarding.
Rule26: If a passenger shows a ticket, then security clearance is granted to the passenger.
Rule27: Under the condition that a passenger shows identification, security clearance is granted to the passenger.
Rule28: Provided that a passenger entered the security area, the passenger shows a ticket.
Rule29: Either a passenger entered the security area or a passenger is at the checkpoint.

Rule30: Under the condition that it is not the case that if a security officer is present, then a passenger at the checkpoint shows identification, the security officer does not request authorization from a supervisor.
Rule31: If it is not the case that provided a supervisor is notified by a security officer, the security officer escalates to a supervisor, then a vehicle inspection is completed.

Rule32: Under the condition that it is not the case that whenever a supervisor is notified by a security officer, the security officer escalates to a supervisor, a vehicle inspection is not completed.
Rule33: Provided that it is not the case that if boarding is announced for a flight, boarding has started for the flight, boarding is delayed for the flight.

Rule34: Provided that it is not the case that under the condition that it is not the case that either alcohol is detected in a vehicle or a suspicious package is in a vehicle, a routine inspection occurs on the vehicle, a supervisor is notified by the security officer.

Rule35: If it is not the case that provided it is not the case that either alcohol is detected in a vehicle or a suspicious package is in a vehicle, a routine inspection occurs on the vehicle, the security officer does not escalate to a supervisor.
Rule36: Provided that a vehicle inspection is not required, the vehicle is cleared.
Rule37: If security protocol is not activated by the security system, then the terminal is under normal operations.
Rule38: Under the condition that security clearance is not granted to a passenger, the passenger is allowed to board the flight.
Rule39: Provided that security clearance is not granted to a passenger, the terminal is under emergency lockdown.
facts: Fact1: A security officer is present.
Fact2: The security system is activated.
Fact3: A routine inspection does not occur on a vehicle.
Fact4: Passenger boarding is not occurring for a flight.
Fact5: A passenger is not cleared for boarding.

question: Security clearance is granted to a passenger.
